Package kentico.kontent.delivery

Class SimpleInMemoryCacheManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • kentico.kontent.delivery.SimpleInMemoryCacheManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheManager
    public class SimpleInMemoryCacheManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements CacheManager
    Uses the JVM memory to cache results. It also allows cache to be invalidated based on both the codename and language of content items. This makes it easy to invalidate the cache for incoming webhooks.

    This implementation mainly serves as an example. Do not use this cache manager when your application is deployed as multiple replicas! In that case a centralized cache (e.g. Redis) is advisable.

        Retrieve an earlier cached response from the KenticoKontentDelivery API.
        Specified by:
        get in interface CacheManager
        Parameters:
        url - The url that would be used to retrieve the response from KenticoKontent Delivery API.
        Returns:

        Specified by:
        put in interface CacheManager

        url - the URL that was used to retrieve the response from the KenticoKontentDelivery API.
        jsonNode - the JsonNode created from the response from the KenticoKontent Delivery API.
        containedContentItems - (null allowed) can be used to inspect the original contents of the JsonNode and allow for precise cache invalidation (if implemented).
